00141 const SDMMC004_CommandType SDMMC004_Command[40] =
00142 {

00144     { 0,0,0,0,0,0,SDMMC004_GO_IDLE_STATE,0 },     /*0*/
00145     { 1,0,1,0,0,0,SDMMC004_ALL_SEND_CID,0 },      /*1*/
00146     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_RELATIVE_ADDR,0}, /*2*/
00147     { 0,0,0,0,0,0,SDMMC004_SET_DSR,0 },           /*3*/
00148     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC,0},        /*4*/
00149     { 3,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SELECT_DESELECT_CARD,0},/*5*/
00150     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SD_SEND_IF_COND,0},    /*6*/
00151     { 1,0,1,0,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_CSD,0},           /*7*/
00152     { 1,0,1,0,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_CID,0},           /*8*/
00153     { 3,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_STOP_TRANSMISSION,0},  /*9*/
00154     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SEND_STATUS,0 },       /*10*/
00155     { 0,0,0,0,0,0,SDMMC004_GO_INACTIVE_STATE,0},  /*11*/
00156     { 2,0,1,1,0,0,SDMMC004_SET_BLOCKLEN,0},       /*12*/

00160     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_WRITE_MULTIPLE_BLOCK,0},/*16*/
00161     { 2,0,1,1,1,0,SDMMC004_PROGRAM_CSD,0},        /*17*/

00193  * Application Specific Commands.

00196 {
00197     0, 0xFF,1,2,3,0xFF,4,5,6,7,8,0xFF,9,10,0xFF,\
00198     11, 12, 13, 14,0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF,\
00199     15, 16, 0xFF, 17, 18, 19, 20, 0xFF, 21, 22,\
00200     0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 23, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF,\
00201     24, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF,\
00202     0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 25, 26, 0xFF, \
00203     27, 28, 29,30,31,32,33
00204 };

00218 /*******************************************************************************

00221 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_1>>> */
00222 /*
00223  * This function resets the Host Controller's register depending on the
00224  * parameter passed.
00225  */
00226 status_t SDMMC004_lReset( uint8_t Reset )
00227 {
00228   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00229 
00230   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00231   SDMMC->SW_RESET =  (SDMMC->SW_RESET | Reset);
00232   /* The Host Controller takes some time to complete software reset*/
00233   osDelay(SDMMC004_RESET_DELAY);
00234   if (SDMMC->SW_RESET & Reset)
00235   {
00236     Status = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00237   }
00238   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00239   return Status;
00240 }
00241 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_2>>> */
00242 /*
00243  * This function clears the card related structures and stops the SD clock.
00244  */
00245 void SDMMC004_lCardCleanUp()
00246 {
00247   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00248   memset((void*)&SDMMC004_CardInfo,0,sizeof(SDMMC004_CardInfo));
00249   SDMMC004_Handle.CardType = 0;
00250   SDMMC004_Handle.f8 = 0;
00251   SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00252   SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00253   SDMMC004_Handle.ErrorRecoveryStatus = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00254   SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00255   SDMMC004_Handle.State  = 0;
00256   /* Stop the SD Clock Enable */
00257   CLR_BIT( SDMMC->CLOCK_CTRL,SDMMC_CLOCK_CTRL_SDCLOCK_EN_Pos  );
00258   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00259 }
00260 
00261 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3>>> */
00262 /*
00263  * This function checks whether the CMD and DATA lines are free before issuing
00264  * any command.
00265  */
00266 status_t SDMMC004_lCheckDatCmdline(const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr)
00267 {
00268   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00269   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00270   do
00271   {
00272 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00273     if( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataCmdLineBusy == TRUE)
00274     {
00275       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CMD_LINE_BUSY;
00276       break;
00277     }
00278 #endif
00279     /* Read from Present state register to Check Cmd line is free */
00280     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_1>>> */
00281     if ( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_CMD_Msk)
00282     {
00283       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CMD_LINE_BUSY;
00284       break;
00285     }
00286     /* Check for  data line for Send Status command  and all those commands using
00287    data line */
00288     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_2>>> */
00289     if (( 1UL == CommandPtr->DataPresentSelect) ||  \
00290         ( (SDMMC004_SEND_STATUS == CommandPtr->CommandIndex) || \
00291             (3UL == CommandPtr->ResponseTypeSelect) )
00292        )
00293     {
00294       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_3>>> */
00295       /* Read from Present state register to Check data line is free */
00296       if ( (SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_DAT_Msk )!= 0)
00297       {
00298         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_DATA_LINE_BUSY;
00299         break;
00300       }
00301       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_3_4>>> */
00302       else
00303       {
00304         /* Update the data line state to active */
00305         if( (1UL == CommandPtr->DataPresentSelect) ||
00306             (3UL == CommandPtr->ResponseTypeSelect) )
00307         {
00308           SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_DATA_ACTIVE;
00309         }
00310       }
00311     }
00312     /* Update the Command line state to active */
00313     SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
00314   } while(0);
00315   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00316   return Status;
00317 }
00318 
00319 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4>>> */
00320 /*
00321  * This function checks response error types in Command's Arguments category
00322  */
00323 void SDMMC004_lCheckArgumentError
00324 (
00325   const uint32_t  *CardStatusPtr,
00326   uint8_t *ErrorPtr
00327 )
00328 {
00329   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00330   /* The command's argument was out of the allowed range for this card.*/
00331   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_1>>> */
00332   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_OUT_OF_RANGE_BITMASK ) != 0)
00333   {
00334     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00335     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, SDMMC004_OUT_OF_RANGE_ERROR,0,NULL);
00336   } /*End of "if( *CardStatusPtr & CSR_OUT_OF_RANGE_BITMASK ) "*/
00337 
00338   /* A mis-aligned address which did not match the block length was used in
00339    * the command.*/
00340   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_2>>> */
00341   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ADDRESS_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00342   {
00343     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00344     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, SDMMC004_ADDRESS_ERROR,0,NULL);
00345   } /*End of " if ( *CardStatusPtr & CSR_ADDRESS_ERROR_BITMASK) "*/
00346 
00347   /* The transferred block length is not allowed for this card, or the number
00348    * of transferred bytes does not match the block length.*/
00349   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_3>>> */
00350   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_BLOCK_LEN_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00351   {
00352     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00353     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_BLOCK_LEN_ERROR,0,NULL);
00354   }/*End of " if (*CardStatusPtr & CSR_BLOCK_LEN_ERROR_BITMASK) "*/
00355 
00356   /* Set when the host attempts to write to a protected block or to the
00357      temporary or permanent write protected card.*/
00358   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_4_4>>> */
00359   if (( *CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_WP_VIOLATION_BITMASK ) != 0)
00360   {
00361     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00362     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_WP_VIOLATION_ERROR,0,NULL);
00363   }/*End of "if ( *CardStatusPtr & CSR_WP_VIOLATION_BITMASK ) "*/
00364   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00365 }
00366 
00367 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5>>> */
00368 /*
00369  * This function checks response error types in Erase category
00370  */
00371 void SDMMC004_lCheckEraseError
00372 (
00373     const uint32_t *CardStatusPtr,
00374     uint8_t *ErrorPtr
00375 )
00376 {
00377   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00378   /* An error in the sequence of erase commands occurred.*/
00379   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5_1>>> */
00380   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ERASE_SEQ_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00381   {
00382     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00383     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_ERASE_SEQ_ERROR,0,NULL);
00384   }
00385   /* An invalid selection of write-blocks for erase occurred.*/
00386   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5_2>>> */
00387   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ERASE_PARAM_BITMASK) != 0)
00388   {
00389     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00390     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_ERASE_PARAM_ERROR,0,NULL);
00391   }
00392   /* Set when only partial address space was erased due to existing
00393    * write protected blocks or the temporary or permanent write protected card
00394    *  was erased.*/
00395   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_5_3>>> */
00396   if (( *CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_WP_ERASE_SKIP_BITMASK) != 0)
00397   {
00398     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00399     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_WP_ERASE_SKIP_ERROR,0,NULL);
00400   }
00401   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00402 }
00403 
00404 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6>>> */
00405 /*
00406  * This function checks response error types in card's internal error category
00407  */
00408 void SDMMC004_lCheckCardError
00409 (
00410   const uint32_t *CardStatusPtr,
00411   uint8_t *ErrorPtr
00412 )
00413 {
00414   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00415   /* Card internal ECC was applied but failed to correct the data.*/
00416   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6_1>>> */
00417   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_CARD_ECC_FAILED_BITMASK) != 0)
00418   {
00419     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00420     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_CARD_ECC_ERROR,0,NULL);
00421   }
00422   /* Internal card controller error*/
00423   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6_2>>> */
00424   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_CC_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00425   {
00426     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00427     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_CC_ERROR,0,NULL);
00428   }
00429   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_6_3>>> */
00430   /* A general or an unknown error occurred during the operation.*/
00431   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00432   {
00433     *ErrorPtr = 1UL;
00434     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_UNKNOWN_ERROR,0,NULL);
00435   }
00436   /* Debug Log message .*/
00437   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00438 }
00439 
00440 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7>>> */
00441 /*
00442  * This function checks for any error in the command's response received.
00443  */
00444 status_t SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse( const uint32_t *CardStatusPtr)
00445 {
00446   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00447   uint8_t ErrorStatus = 0;      /* No Error */
00448   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00449 
00450   /* Argument Related Error Function */
00451   SDMMC004_lCheckArgumentError( CardStatusPtr, &ErrorStatus );
00452 
00453   /* Erase Related Error function  */
00454   SDMMC004_lCheckEraseError( CardStatusPtr, &ErrorStatus);
00455 
00456   /* Card Related Error function */
00457   SDMMC004_lCheckCardError(CardStatusPtr, &ErrorStatus);
00458 
00459   /* Set when a sequence or password error has been detected in lock/unlock
00460    * card command.*/
00461   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_1>>> */
00462   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_LOCK_UNLOCK_FAILED_BITMASK) != 0)
00463   {
00464     ErrorStatus = 1UL;
00465     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_LOCK_UNLOCK_ERROR,0,NULL);
00466   }
00467 
00468   /* Can be either one of the following errors:
00469    * The read only section of the CSD does not match the card content.
00470    *  An attempt to reverse the copy  or permanent WP  bits was made.
00471    */
00472   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_4>>> */
00473   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_CSD_OVERWRITE_BITMASK) != 0)
00474   {
00475     ErrorStatus = 1UL;
00476     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_CSD_OVERWRITE,0,NULL);
00477   }
00478   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_5>>> */
00479   /* Error in the sequence of the authentication process*/
00480   if ((*CardStatusPtr & SDMMC004_CSR_ASK_SEQ_ERROR_BITMASK) != 0)
00481   {
00482     ErrorStatus = 1UL;
00483     ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x,SDMMC004_ASK_SEQ_ERROR,0,NULL);
00484   }
00485   /* Below Additional condition is because some SD cards treat CMD55 as Illegal
00486    * Command and gives this error in response */
00487   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_7_6>>> */
00488   if (ErrorStatus == 1UL) 
00489   {
00490     Status = (uint32_t) SDMMC004_ERROR;
00491   }
00492   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00493   return Status;
00494 }
00495 
00496 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_41>>> */
00497 /*
00498  * This function checks for lock status of SDMMC card.
00499  */
00500 void SDMMC004_lGetCardLockState(uint32_t CardStatus, uint16_t CommandIndex)
00501 {
00502 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_41_1>>> */
00503   if (((CardStatus & SDMMC004_CSR_CARD_IS_LOCKED_BITMASK) != 0) &&
00504       (CommandIndex != SDMMC004_SEND_RELATIVE_ADDR ))
00505   {
00506     SDMMC004_Handle.State |= SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_LOCKED ;
00507   }
00508 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_41_2>>> */
00509   else
00510   {
00511     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_LOCKED ;
00512   }
00513 }
00514 
00515 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_42>>> */
00516 /*
00517  * This function provide the delay in transfer.
00518  */
00519 status_t SDMMC004_lTransferDelay(uint32_t DelayTime)
00520 {
00521   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00522   SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait ( \
00523                                     SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId,\
00524                                     DelayTime);
00525   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_42_1>>> */
00526   if(  SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex < 0)
00527   {
00528     Status = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00529   }
00530   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_42_2>>> */
00531   if( SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError !=  SDMMC004_TRANSFER_COMPLETE)
00532   {
00533     Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError;
00534   }
00535   return Status;
00536 }
00537 
00538 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8>>> */
00539 /*
00540  * This function reads for the response received for the command issued.
00541  */
00542 status_t  SDMMC004_lReadResponse
00543 (
00544   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
00545   SDMMC004_ResponseType ResponseType,
00546   void *ResponsePtr
00547 )
00548 {
00549   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
00550   uint32_t ErrorStatus = 0;
00551   uint32_t *TmpPtr;
00552   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00553   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00554   /* Check for  No response type commands */
00555   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_1>>> */
00556   if (CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_IDLE_STATE || \
00557       CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_INACTIVE_STATE)
00558   {
00559     Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00560   }
00561   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_2>>> */
00562   else
00563   {
00564     TmpPtr = (uint32_t *)ResponsePtr;
00565     CardStatus = SDMMC->RESPONSE0;
00566     /* Check Lock Status */
00567   /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_3>>> */
00568     SDMMC004_lGetCardLockState(CardStatus, CommandPtr->CommandIndex);
00569     /* Check response type*/
00570     switch( ResponseType )
00571     {
00572     /* Response R1*/
00573     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_4>>> */
00574     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1:
00575       /* check the error bits in the response */
00576       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00577       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_5>>> */
00578       Status = SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse(&CardStatus);
00579       break;
00580 
00581       /* Response R1b*/
00582       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_6>>> */
00583     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1b:
00584       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00585       /* check the error bits in the response */
00586       Status = SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse(&CardStatus);
00587       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
00588       {
00589         break;
00590       }
00591 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00592       if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TransferInterruptError == TRUE)
00593       {
00594         /* Release the Semaphore */
00595         Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId);
00596         SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00597       }
00598 #endif  /* SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
00599 
00600       /*Wait for the transfer complete Interrupt */
00601       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_7>>> */
00602       Status = SDMMC004_lTransferDelay(SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_TRANSFER);
00603       if(Status != (uint32_t) DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
00604       {
00605         ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status, 0, NULL);
00606         break;
00607       }
00608 
00609 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00610       if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TransferInterruptError == TRUE)
00611       {
00612         /* Enable the Transfer Complete Status Interrupt */
00613         SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00614         /*  Enable the Transfer Complete Signal Interrupt */
00615         SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00616       }
00617 #endif     /* SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
00618       break;
00619    /* Response R2*/
00620    /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_8>>> */
00621     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R2:
00622       /* Response register R0-R7 */
00623       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00624       TmpPtr++;
00625 
00626       *TmpPtr = SDMMC->RESPONSE2;
00627       TmpPtr++;
00628 
00629       *TmpPtr = SDMMC->RESPONSE4;
00630       TmpPtr++;
00631 
00632       *TmpPtr = SDMMC->RESPONSE6;
00633       break;
00634     /* Response R3*/
00635     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_9>>> */
00636     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3:
00637       
00638     /* Response R7*/
00639     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_10>>> */
00640     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R7:
00641       *TmpPtr = CardStatus;
00642       break;
00643 
00644     /* Response R6*/
00645     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_11>>> */
00646     case SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R6:
00647       ErrorStatus  = CardStatus & SDMMC_RESPONSE0_RESPONSE0_Msk;
00648       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_12>>> */
00649       Status = SDMMC004_lCheckErrorInResponse(&ErrorStatus);
00650       /* Read the 16bit RCA received in Response R1 register */
00651       *TmpPtr =(uint16_t)((CardStatus & SDMMC_RESPONSE0_RESPONSE1_Msk) >> \
00652           SDMMC004_HC_RESPONSE1_BITPOS );
00653       break;
00654 
00655     /* No response*/
00656     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_8_13>>> */
00657     case SDMMC004_NO_RESPONSE:
00658       Status = DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00659       break;
00660 
00661     default:
00662       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00663       break;
00664     } /* End of " switch( ResponseType )"*/
00665   }/* End of " if (CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_IDLE_STATE ||
00666                CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_GO_INACTIVE_STATE)"*/
00667   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00668   return Status;
00669 }
00670 
00671 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9>>> */
00672 /*
00673  * This function issues the command.
00674  */
00675 status_t SDMMC004_lSendCommand
00676 ( 
00677     const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
00678     uint32_t Argument,
00679     SDMMC004_ResponseType ResponseType,
00680     void *ResponsePtr
00681 )
00682 {
00683   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00684   osStatus SemStatus;
00685   SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort = 0UL;  
00686   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00687   do
00688   {
00689     /*  Take Command Mutex */
00690     SemStatus = osMutexWait(SDMMC004_CmdMutexId,  osWaitForever );
00691     if (osOK != SemStatus)
00692     {
00693       break;
00694     } /* End of " if ((uint32_t)osOK != SemStatus)"*/
00695     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
00696     SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError = SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY;
00697     /* Data or Command line free */
00698     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_1>>>*/
00699     Status = SDMMC004_lCheckDatCmdline(CommandPtr);
00700     if ((Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_DATA_LINE_BUSY) ||
00701         (Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CMD_LINE_BUSY))
00702     {
00703       break;
00704     }
00705     /* Set argument register */
00706     SDMMC->ARGUMENT1 = Argument;
00707     /* Set command register */
00708     SDMMC->COMMAND = (uint16_t)(*(uint16_t *)CommandPtr);
00709 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00710     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
00711     {
00712       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
00713       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0001 ;
00714     }
00715     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseStartError == TRUE)
00716     {
00717       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Index Error Interrupt */
00718       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0008 ;
00719     }
00720     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseEndError == TRUE)
00721     {
00722       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Index Error Interrupt */
00723       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0008 ;
00724     }
00725     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Cmd55Error == TRUE)
00726     {
00727       /* Forcefully trigger the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
00728       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0001 ;
00729     }
00730     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
00731     {
00732       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00733     }
00734 #endif  /*SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/   
00735     /* Blocking until any of the bit in the Interrupt Status Register gets set */
00736     SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait (SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId,\
00737         SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_COMMAND);
00738     if( SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex < 0)
00739     {
00740       break;
00741     } 
00742     /* Check for any errors */
00743     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_3>>> */
00744     if( SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError == SDMMC004_COMMAND_COMPLETE )
00745     {
00746 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00747       if(Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandResponseError == TRUE)
00748       {
00749         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00750         break;
00751       }
00752 #endif
00753       /* Read response received. */
00754       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_4>>>*/
00755       Status = SDMMC004_lReadResponse(CommandPtr,ResponseType,ResponsePtr);
00756       break;
00757     }
00758     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_5>>>*/
00759     /* For Cmd8, check for  Command Timeout Interrupt */
00760     else if ((CommandPtr->CommandIndex == SDMMC004_SD_SEND_IF_COND) &&
00761         (SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError == \
00762             SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR))
00763     {
00764       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR;
00765       break;
00766     }
00767 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00768     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
00769     {
00770       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00771       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00772       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00773       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00774       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00775       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00776     
00777       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00778       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00779     
00780       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00781       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00782     }
00783     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Cmd55Error == TRUE)
00784     {
00785       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00786       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00787       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00788       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00789     
00790       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00791       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
00792     
00793       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00794       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
00795     
00796       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00797       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= (SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
00798     }
00799     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
00800     {
00801       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00802       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00803       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00804       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00805     }
00806 
00807     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseEndError == TRUE)
00808     {
00809       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00810       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00811       /* Enable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00812       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00813     }
00814     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_EraseStartError == TRUE)
00815     {
00816       /* Enable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
00817       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM |=  SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk;
00818       /* Disable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
00819       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM |=  SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk ;
00820     }
00821 #endif  /*SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
00822 
00823 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
00824     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC8Error == TRUE)
00825     {
00826       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00827     }
00828     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC10Error == TRUE)
00829     {
00830       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00831     }
00832     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC13Error == TRUE)
00833     {
00834       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00835     }
00836     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC17Error == TRUE)
00837     {
00838       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00839     }
00840     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC20Error == TRUE)
00841     {
00842       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = FALSE;
00843     }
00844 #endif /* SDMMC_UVP_TEST  */
00845 
00846     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_9_6>>>*/
00847     if (CommandPtr->DataPresentSelect == 1)
00848     {
00849       SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort = 1UL;
00850     }
00851     /* Error Recovery for the failed command  */
00852     Status = SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptRecovery( SDMMC004_ISRContext.InterruptStatusShadow, \
00853                                                SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort);
00854   } while(0);
00855   /*Releasing the Command Semaphore */
00856   if (SemStatus == osOK)
00857   {
00858     SemStatus = osMutexRelease (SDMMC004_CmdMutexId);
00859     if (SemStatus != osOK)
00860     {
00861       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_SENDCOMMAND_ERROR;
00862     } /* End of "if (osOK != SemStatus)"*/
00863   }
00864   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00865   return Status;
00866 }
00867 
00868 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10>>> */
00869 /*
00870  * This function sets the voltage window in OCR register
00871  */
00872 status_t  SDMMC004_lSetVoltageWindow()
00873 {
00874   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
00875   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
00876   uint32_t Argument = 0;
00877   uint32_t LoopCount= 0;
00878   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00879   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_1>>> */
00880   /* For Standard Capacity Card  */
00881   if (SDMMC004_Handle.f8 == 0)
00882   {
00883     /* Set HCS = 0  */
00884     Argument = SDMMC004_SD_ACMD41_F80_ARG;
00885   }
00886   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_2>>> */
00887   /* For High Capacity Card */
00888   else
00889   {
00890     /* Set  HCS = 1 */
00891     Argument = SDMMC004_SD_ACMD41_F81_ARG;
00892   }
00893   do
00894   {
00895     /*Send Command55 for Application Specific Command with default RCA as 0*/
00896     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)),\
00897                                      SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,\
00898                                      &CardStatus);
00899     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_3>>> */
00900     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
00901     {
00902       break;
00903     }
00904     /* Send ACMD41 to Set the card's voltage window */
00905     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(62)),\
00906                                     Argument,\
00907                                     SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3,  \
00908                                     &(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr));
00909     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_10_4>>> */
00910     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS && \
00911         (Status != (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR))
00912     {
00913       break;
00914     }
00915     Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00916     /* Cards takes some time to set power status bit. Put some delay*/
00917     /* Timeout of 10 ms.*/
00918     SDMMC004_lDelay(SDMMC004_CARD_POWER_DELAY);
00919     /* Check for busy bit in the OCR content i.e response */
00920   } while(!(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_OCR_POWER_STATUS_BITMASK) &&\
00921             ( (LoopCount++)<50 ) );
00922   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00923   return Status;
00924 }
00925 
00926 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11>>> */
00927 /*
00928  * This function queries Voltage operating condition of the card.
00929  */
00930 status_t SDMMC004_lQueryOperatingCond()
00931 {
00932   uint32_t ResponseData = 0;
00933   status_t Status;
00934   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00935   /*Query voltage operating condition i.e. cmd8 */
00936   Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(8)),\
00937                                     SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_ARG,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R7, \
00938                                     &ResponseData );
00939   do
00940   {
00941     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_1>>> */
00942     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
00943     {
00944       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_2>>> */
00945       /*  No response is received for Standard Capacity SD cards or MMC card. */
00946       if (SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError == \
00947           SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR )
00948       {
00949         SDMMC004_Handle.f8 = 0;
00950         Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
00951       }
00952       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_3>>> */
00953       else
00954       {
00955         break;
00956       }
00957     }
00958     /* Response received i.e. High Capacity cards. */
00959     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_4>>> */
00960     else
00961     {
00962       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_5>>> */
00963       /* Check whether Check pattern matches in the Argument and Response */
00964       if (( (ResponseData >> SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_CHECK_PATTERN_BITPOS) &\
00965           SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_CHECK_PATTERN_BITMASK) != \
00966           (SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_CHECK_PATTERN_VALUE)
00967       )
00968       {
00969         Status  = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_BAD_RESPONSE;
00970         break;
00971       }
00972       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_11_6>>> */
00973       /* Check the Voltage Supplied is Accepted by the card in the response  */
00974       if( ((uint8_t)( ResponseData >> SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_VHS_BITPOS) &\
00975           SDMMC004_SD_CMD8_VHS_BITMASK) \
00976           != ( SDMMC004_SD_VHS_PATTERN_2_7_3_6_VALUE ) )
00977       {
00978         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_BAD_RESPONSE;
00979         break;
00980       }
00981       /* Set Flag f8 */
00982       SDMMC004_Handle.f8 = 1;
00983     }
00984   } while(0);
00985   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
00986   return Status;
00987 }
00988 
00989 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12>>> */
00990 /*
00991  * This function queries voltage supported from the card.
00992  */
00993 status_t SDMMC004_lQueryVoltage (uint32_t Argument)
00994 {
00995   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
00996   status_t Status;
00997   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
00998   do
00999   {
01000     /* Send Command55 for Application Specific Command with default RCA as 0*/
01001     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)),\
01002         Argument,\
01003         SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,\
01004         &CardStatus);
01005     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_1>>> */
01006     if (Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01007     {
01008       /* Some SD cards which doen't supports CMD8 treat cmd55 as illegal so
01009        * ignore this error */
01010       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_2>>> */
01011       if (!( (Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR) &&
01012           (SDMMC004_Handle.f8 == 0) ))
01013       {
01014         break;
01015       }
01016     }
01017     /* Send ACMD41 to query the card's voltage window */
01018     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(62)),Argument,\
01019                                   SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3,&(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr));
01020     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_3>>> */
01021     if ( (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS) &&\
01022          (Status != (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR))
01023     {
01024       /* No response means SDMMC_MMC card */
01025 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01026       /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_4>>> */
01027       if (Status == (uint32_t) SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR)
01028       {
01029         Status  =  (uint32_t)SDMMC004_lInitializeMmcCard();
01030         break;
01031       }
01032       else
01033 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD */
01034       {
01035         break;
01036       }
01037     }
01038     /* Send ACMD41 with voltage window argument set */
01039     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_5>>> */
01040     Status = SDMMC004_lSetVoltageWindow();
01041     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01042     {
01043       break;
01044     }
01045     /* SD Card Type */
01046     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_12_6>>> */
01047     SDMMC004_lWriteCardType();
01048   } while(0);
01049   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01050   return Status;
01051 }
01052 
01053 /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13>>> */
01054 /*
01055  * This function reads the card registers after the card is initialized.
01056  */
01057 status_t SDMMC004_lAfterCardInitialize()
01058 {
01059   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01060   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01061   do
01062   {
01063     /* Read CSD & SCR Register & Card Write Protection Flags. */
01064     Status = SDMMC004_lReadCardRegisters();
01065     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13_1>>> */
01066     if(Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01067     {
01068       break;
01069     }
01070 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_4_BUS_WIDTH
01071     /* Switch  to 4-bit bus width if supported */
01072     Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchBusWidth();
01073     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13_2>>> */
01074     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01075     {
01076       /* Change bus width to default in the Host Controller */
01077       CLR_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_DATA_TX_WIDTH_Pos);
01078     }
01079     /* Switch  to High Speed Mode */
01080     Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchSpeed();
01081     /*<<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_13_3>>> */
01082     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01083     {
01084       /* Change Speed mode to default in the Host Controller */
01085       CLR_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_HIGH_SPEED_EN_Pos );
01086       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01087     }
01088 #endif
01089   } while(0);
01090   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01091   return Status;
01092 }
01093 
01094 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14>>> */
01095 /*
01096  * This function initializes the SD card.
01097  */
01098 status_t SDMMC004_lInitializeCard()
01099 {
01100   status_t Status;
01101   uint32_t LockStatus ;
01102   uint8_t Count= 0;
01103   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01104   do
01105   {
01106     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_1>>> */
01107     /* Repeat the below steps 2 times if bad response is received.    */
01108     do
01109     {
01110       /* Reset the card. i.e cmd0 */
01111       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(0)), \
01112                                       SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,SDMMC004_NO_RESPONSE, \
01113                                       NULL);
01114       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_2>>> */
01115       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01116       {
01117         break;
01118       }
01119       /* Query the Operation Condition Info from the card.*/
01120       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_3>>> */
01121       Status = SDMMC004_lQueryOperatingCond();
01122       Count++;
01123     } while(( Count < SDMMC004_NUM_CARD_RESET_RETRIES) && \
01124             ( Status == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_BAD_RESPONSE));
01125     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_4>> */
01126     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01127     {
01128       break;
01129     }
01130     /* Query & Set voltage window  */
01131     Status = SDMMC004_lQueryVoltage(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca);
01132     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_5>> */
01133     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01134     {
01135       break;
01136     }
01137     /* Read CID */
01138     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(2)), \
01139                                    SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R2, \
01140                                    (void *)SDMMC004_CardInfo.CidArray);
01141     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_6>> */
01142     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01143     {
01144       break;
01145     }
01146     /* Read RCA */
01147     Status = SDMMC004_lReadRca();
01148     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_7>> */
01149     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01150     {
01151       break;
01152     } 
01153     /* Check the card Lock/ Unlock Status */
01154     Status = SDMMC004_GetLockStatus(&LockStatus);
01155     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_8>> */
01156     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01157     {
01158       break;
01159     }
01160     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_14_9>> */
01161     if (LockStatus == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CARD_IS_LOCKED)
01162     {
01163       SDMMC004_Handle.State |= SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_LOCKED ;
01164       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_INITIALIZED_BUT_LOCKED;     
01165     }
01166     /* Update card initialization Status */
01167     SDMMC004_Handle.State |= SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_INITIALIZED;
01168     SDMMC004_Handle.State &=  ~(SDMMC004_STATE_NO_CARD);
01169   } while(0);
01170   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01171   return Status;
01172 }
01173 
01174 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15>>> */
01175 /*
01176  * This function finds out the card Type information.
01177  */
01178 void SDMMC004_lWriteCardType()
01179 {
01180   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01181   /* If F8 =0 , Standard Capacity V1 Card */
01182   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_1>>> */
01183   if ( SDMMC004_Handle.f8 == 0)
01184   {
01185     SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_SD_STANDARD_CAPACITY_V1x;
01186   }
01187   /* If F8 =1 , Standard Capacity V2 or High Capacity Card */
01188   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_2>>> */
01189   else
01190   {
01191     /* Check CCS bit in the OCR register, CCS=1 means High Capacity  card*/
01192     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_3>>> */
01193     if ((SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_OCR_CCS_BITMASK ) != 0)
01194     {
01195       SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_SD_HIGH_CAPACITY | \
01196           SDMMC004_BLOCK_ADDRESSING;
01197     }
01198     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_15_4>>> */
01199     /* CCS=0 means Standard Capacity Version2*/
01200     else
01201     {
01202       SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_SD_STANDARD_CAPACITY_V2;
01203     }
01204   }
01205   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01206 }
01207 
01208 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16>>> */
01209 /*
01210  * This function finds out the Write protection status of the card.
01211  */
01212 status_t SDMMC004_lSetWriteProtect (void)
01213 {
01214   uint32_t SdStatus[16] = {0};
01215   uint32_t WriteProtect;
01216   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01217   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01218   do
01219   {
01220 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01221     SDMMC004_MMCCSDType *TmpMmcCsdPtr;
01222     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_1>>> */
01223     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01224     {
01225       TmpMmcCsdPtr = (SDMMC004_MMCCSDType *)&SDMMC004_CardInfo.CsdArray;
01226       /* Read Write Protection bits from CSD Register i.e both Temp & Permanent */
01227       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_2>>> */
01228       if ( ((TmpMmcCsdPtr->TempWriteProtect) != 0) ||
01229           ((TmpMmcCsdPtr->PermWriteProtect) != 0))
01230       {
01231         SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_WRITE_PROTECT;
01232       }
01233     }
01234     else
01235 #endif
01236     {
01237       /* SD Card Write Protection.  */
01238       Status  = SDMMC004_GetSdStatus((void*)&(SdStatus[0]));
01239       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_3>>> */
01240       if (Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01241       {
01242         break;
01243       }
01244       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_16_4>>> */
01245       /* Bits 480:495 in the SD status gives the Write Protection Information */
01246       WriteProtect = ((SdStatus[0] & 0xFF000000) >> 24 ) | 
01247           (((SdStatus[0] & 0x00FF0000) >> 16 ) << 8) ;
01248       if ( (WriteProtect & SDMMC004_SD_CARD_TYPE_BITMASK) != 0 )
01249       {
01250         SDMMC004_Handle.State |=(uint32_t)SDMMC004_STATE_CARD_WRITE_PROTECT;
01251       }
01252     }
01253   } while(0);
01254   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01255   return Status;
01256 }
01257 
01258 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_17>>> */
01259 /*
01260  * This function reads the  Relative card address of the card.
01261  */
01262 status_t SDMMC004_lReadRca()
01263 {
01264   status_t Status ;
01265 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01266   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01267 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD */
01268   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01269   /*  Read RCA for MMC card */
01270 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01271   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_17_1>>> */
01272   if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01273   {
01274     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(3)),\
01275             (uint32_t)SDMMC004_MMC_DEFAULT_RCA, SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,&CardStatus);
01276     SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca = SDMMC004_MMC_DEFAULT_RCA;
01277   }
01278   /*  Read RCA for SD  */
01279   else
01280 #endif
01281   {
01282     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_17_2>>> */
01283     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(3)), \
01284                                       SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0, \
01285                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R6, \
01286                                      &(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca));
01287                                   }
01288   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01289   return Status;
01290 }
01291 
01292 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18>>> */
01293 /*
01294  * This function initializes the MMC card.
01295  */
01296 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01297 /* SDMMC_MMC Initialize */
01298 status_t SDMMC004_lInitializeMmcCard()
01299 {
01300   status_t Status;
01301   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01302   do
01303   {
01304     /* Reset the card. i.e cmd0 */
01305     Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(0)), \
01306                                               SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,  \
01307                                               SDMMC004_NO_RESPONSE, NULL);
01308     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18_1>>> */
01309     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01310     {
01311       break;
01312     }
01313     /*Command1 indicating support for high capacity cards & voltage 2.7 to 3.6v */
01314     do
01315     {
01316       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_MMC_COMMAND(1)), \
01317                                       MMC_CMD1_ARG ,SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R3,\
01318                                       &(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr) );
01319       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18_2>>> */
01320       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01321       {
01322         break;
01323       }/* End of "if(Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS )" */
01324     } while(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_OCR_POWER_STATUS_BITMASK );
01325 
01326     /* Check mode. 00b (byte mode) & 10b (sector mode)*/
01327     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_18_3>>> */
01328     if( ((SDMMC004_CardInfo.Ocr & SDMMC004_MMC_OCR_ACCESS_MODE_BITMASK) >> \
01329         (SDMMC004_MMC_OCR_ACCESS_MODE_BITPOS) != 0))
01330     {
01331       SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_BLOCK_ADDRESSING;
01332     }
01333     SDMMC004_Handle.CardType |= SDMMC004_MMC;
01334   } while(0);
01335   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01336   return Status;
01337 }
01338 #endif
01339 
01340 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19>>> */
01341 /*
01342  * This function reads the CSD, SCR and Write protection status of the card.
01343  */
01344 status_t SDMMC004_lReadCardRegisters (void)
01345 {
01346   uint32_t Argument = 0;
01347   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01348   status_t Status;
01349   SDMMC004_SCRType ScrContent = {0};
01350   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01351   do
01352   {
01353     /* Read CSD Register  */
01354     Argument |= SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca << SDMMC004_ARG_RCA_BITPOS;
01355     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(9)),Argument, \
01356                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R2, \
01357                                       (void *)SDMMC004_CardInfo.CsdArray);
01358     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_1>>> */
01359     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01360     {
01361       break;
01362     }
01363     /* Set Write protection flags */
01364     Status = SDMMC004_lSetWriteProtect();
01365     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_2>>> */
01366     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01367     {
01368       break;
01369     }
01370     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_3>>> */
01371     /* Read SCR register for SD card */
01372     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) == 0)
01373     {
01374       /* Switch to Transferring State. */
01375       Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01376       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_4>>> */
01377       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01378       {
01379         break;
01380       }
01381       /*Send the Application Specific Command i.e. Command 55.*/
01382       Argument |= SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca << SDMMC004_ARG_RCA_BITPOS;
01383       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)), \
01384                                         Argument, SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, \
01385                                         &CardStatus );
01386       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_5>>> */
01387       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01388       {
01389         break;
01390       }
01391       /* Set Direction Select bit in the Transfer Mode register */
01392       SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_TX_DIR_SELECT_Pos);
01393       /* Read the transferred SCR data*/
01394       Status = SDMMC004_lSingleBlockTransfer( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(64)), \
01395                                                 SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0,8, \
01396                                                 (uint32_t *)&ScrContent, \
01397                                                 SDMMC004_READ_FROM_BUFF);
01398       SDMMC004_CardInfo.Scr = ScrContent;
01399       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_19_6>>> */
01400       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01401       {
01402         break;
01403       }
01404     } /* End of " if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) == 0)"*/
01405   } while(0);
01406   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01407   return Status;
01408 }
01409 
01410 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_20>>> */
01411 /*
01412  * This function configures the registers for Single Block Transfer.
01413  */
01414 status_t SDMMC004_lConfigureForSingleTransfer
01415 (
01416   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
01417   uint32_t Argument,
01418   uint16_t BlockSize
01419 )
01420 {
01421   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01422   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01423   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01424   do
01425   {
01426     /* Set Block Size Register */
01427     WR_REG( SDMMC->BLOCK_SIZE,SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Msk , \
01428             SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Pos,BlockSize );
01429     /* Clear the Multi Block Select bit */
01430     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_MULTI_BLOCK_SELECT_Pos);
01431     /* Clear the ACMD Enable bit*/
01432     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_ACMD_EN_Pos);
01433     /* Clear the Block Count Enable bit*/
01434     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_BLOCK_COUNT_EN_Pos);
01435 
01436 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
01437     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC13Error == TRUE)
01438     {
01439       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt =TRUE ;
01440     }
01441     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC20Error == TRUE)
01442     {
01443       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt =TRUE ;
01444     }
01445 
01446     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
01447     {
01448       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt =TRUE ;
01449     }
01450     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01451     {
01452       /* Disable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
01453       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01454       /* Disable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
01455       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~( SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01456 
01457       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01458       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01459       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01460       /* Disable the Buffer Write  Status & Signal Interrupt */
01461       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01462       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01463       /* Disable the Transfer Complete  Status & Signal Interrupt */
01464       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01465       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01466     }
01467     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01468     {
01469       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01470       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01471       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01472       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01473       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01474       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01475     }
01476 #endif
01477     /* Send Single Block Transfer Command */
01478     Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_lSendCommand( CommandPtr, Argument, \
01479                                               SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,&CardStatus);
01480     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_20_1>>> */
01481     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01482     {
01483       break;
01484     }
01485   } while(0);
01486   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01487   return Status;
01488 }
01489 
01490 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_21>>> */
01491 /*
01492  * This function configures the registers for Multiple Block Transfer.
01493  */
01494 status_t SDMMC004_lConfigureRegForMultiTransfer
01495 (
01496   uint32_t *TmpAddrPtr,
01497   uint32_t NumberOfBlocks,
01498   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr
01499 )
01500 {
01501   status_t Status;
01502   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01503   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01504   do
01505   {
01506     /* Block Addressing */
01507     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_21_1>>> */
01508     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_BLOCK_ADDRESSING) == 0UL)
01509     {
01510       *TmpAddrPtr *= 512UL;
01511     }
01512     /* Set Block Size Register */
01513     WR_REG( SDMMC->BLOCK_SIZE,SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Msk ,  \
01514             SDMMC_BLOCK_SIZE_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_Pos,SDMMC004_TX_BLOCK_SIZE_VALUE);
01515     /* Set Transfer Mode Register */
01516     SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_MULTI_BLOCK_SELECT_Pos);
01517     SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_ACMD_EN_Pos);
01518     SET_BIT( SDMMC->TRANSFER_MODE,SDMMC_TRANSFER_MODE_BLOCK_COUNT_EN_Pos);
01519 
01520     /* Set Block Count Register */
01521     WR_REG( SDMMC->BLOCK_COUNT, SDMMC_BLOCK_COUNT_BLOCK_COUNT_Msk ,\
01522             SDMMC_BLOCK_COUNT_BLOCK_COUNT_Pos, NumberOfBlocks);
01523 
01524     /* Enable ACMD 12 Interrupt Signal  */
01525     SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR &= ~SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR_ACMD_ERR_EN_Msk;
01526     SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR |= SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR_ACMD_ERR_EN_Msk;
01527 
01528 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST 
01529     if ( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC8Error == TRUE)
01530     {
01531       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = TRUE;
01532     }
01533     if ( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC10Error == TRUE)
01534     {
01535       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = TRUE;
01536     }
01537     if ( Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_TC17Error == TRUE)
01538     {
01539       Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt = TRUE;
01540     }
01541     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01542     {
01543       /* Disable the Command Complete Status Interrupt */
01544       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01545       /* Disable the Command Complete Signal Interrupt */
01546       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~( SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01547       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01548       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01549       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01550       /* Disable the Buffer Write Status & Signal Interrupt */
01551       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01552       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01553       /* Disable the Transfer Complete Status & Signal Interrupt */
01554       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01555       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_EN_Msk);
01556     }
01557     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01558     {
01559       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01560       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01561       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_EN_Msk);
01562 
01563       /* Disable the Buffer Ready Status & Signal Interrupt */
01564       SDMMC->EN_INT_STATUS_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01565       SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM &= ~(SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_EN_Msk);
01566     }
01567 #endif
01568     /* Send Multiple Block  Transfer Command */
01569     Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( CommandPtr, *TmpAddrPtr, \
01570                                     SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, &CardStatus );
01571     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_21_2>>> */
01572     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01573     {
01574       break;
01575     }
01576   } while(0);
01577   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01578   return Status;
01579 }
01580 
01581 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22>>> */
01582 /*
01583  * This function is used to transfer multiple blocks of data.
01584  */
01585 status_t SDMMC004_lMultiBlockTransfer 
01586 (
01587   uint32_t *AddrPtr, uint32_t NumberOfBlocks,\
01588   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr, \
01589   uint32_t *BufferPtr, SDMMC004_DataTrasferType TransferMode
01590 )
01591 {
01592   status_t Status ;
01593   SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_ERROR;
01594   do
01595   {
01596     SDMMC004_BufferPtr = BufferPtr;
01597     SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes = SDMMC004_NUM_QUADLETS_IN_BLOCK;
01598     SDMMC004_BlockCount = NumberOfBlocks;
01599     /* Configure Registers for Multi block transfer*/
01600     Status = SDMMC004_lConfigureRegForMultiTransfer( AddrPtr, NumberOfBlocks, \
01601                                                     CommandPtr );
01602     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_1>>> */
01603     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01604     {
01605       break;
01606     }
01607 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
01608     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01609     {
01610       /* Forcefully trigger the Data Crc Error Interrupt */
01611       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0020 ;
01612     }
01613 #endif
01614     /* Read/Write Transfer will be done in when buffer ready interrupt comes  */
01615     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_2>>> */
01616     Status = SDMMC004_lDataTransfer();
01617     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_3>>> */
01618     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01619     {
01620       break;
01621     }
01622     /* Block on Transfer Complete Interrupt */
01623     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_4>>> */
01624     /* Timeout of 1ms.*/
01625     Status = SDMMC004_lTransferDelay(SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_TRANSFER);
01626     if(Status != (uint32_t) DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01627     {
01628       ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status, 0, NULL);
01629       break;
01630     }
01631     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_22_5>>> */
01632     /* Check ACMD status*/
01633     if (SDMMC004_Handle.AcmdInterruptError == SDMMC004_ACMD12_ERROR)
01634     {
01635       /* Call ACMD12 Error Recovery */
01636       SDMMC004_lAcmdErrorRecovery();
01637     }
01638   } while(0);
01639   return Status;
01640 }
01641 
01642 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23>>> */
01643 /*
01644  * This function performs the  Single Block Transfer.
01645  */
01646 status_t SDMMC004_lSingleBlockTransfer
01647 (
01648   const SDMMC004_CommandType *CommandPtr,
01649   uint32_t Argument,
01650   uint16_t BlockSize,
01651   uint32_t *BufferPtr,
01652   SDMMC004_DataTrasferType TransferMode
01653 )
01654 {
01655   status_t Status;
01656   SDMMC004_BufferPtr = BufferPtr;
01657   SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes = BlockSize/4;
01658   SDMMC004_BlockCount = 1;
01659   do
01660   {
01661     /* Configure Register  for Single Block Transfer */
01662     Status = SDMMC004_lConfigureForSingleTransfer(CommandPtr,Argument,BlockSize);
01663     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_1>>> */
01664     if ((uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS != Status)
01665     {
01666       break;
01667     }
01668 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
01669     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_DataErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
01670     {
01671       /* Forcefully trigger the Data Crc Error Interrupt */
01672       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0020 ;
01673     }
01674 #endif
01675     /* Data transfer will be done in Buffer ready interrupt routine*/
01676     Status = SDMMC004_lDataTransfer();
01677     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_2>>> */
01678     if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01679     {
01680       break;
01681     }
01682     /* Block on Transfer Complete Interrupt */
01683     SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait ( \
01684                                       SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId,\
01685                                       SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_TRANSFER);
01686     if(   SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreIndex < 0)
01687     { 
01688       break;
01689     } 
01690     /* Check Transfer Complete Status */
01691     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_4>>> */
01692     if (SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError == SDMMC004_TRANSFER_COMPLETE )
01693     {
01694       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01695     }
01696     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_23_5>>> */
01697     else
01698     {
01699       SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort = 1;
01700       Status = SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptRecovery(\
01701                          SDMMC004_ISRContext.InterruptStatusShadow, \
01702                          SDMMC004_Handle.IssueAbort);
01703       break;
01704     }
01705   } while(0);
01706   return Status;
01707 }
01708 
01709 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_24>>> */
01710 /*
01711  * This function checks the Lock Status .
01712  */
01713 status_t SDMMC004_lCheckLockStatus( SDMMC004_CardLockMode OperationMode )
01714 {
01715   status_t Status ;
01716   uint32_t LockStatus = 0;
01717   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01718   Status =  SDMMC004_GetLockStatus(&LockStatus);
01719   /* For Lock, Card State must be locked */
01720   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_24_1>>> */
01721   if (Status == (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01722   {
01723     if( (LockStatus == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CARD_IS_LOCKED) && \
01724         (OperationMode == SDMMC004_LOCK)
01725        )
01726     {
01727       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01728     }
01729     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_24_2>>> */
01730     /* For UnLock, Card State must be unlock */
01731     else if( (LockStatus == (uint32_t)SDMMC004_CARD_UNLOCKED) && \
01732         (OperationMode == SDMMC004_UNLOCK)
01733     )
01734     {
01735       Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01736     }
01737     /* Some Error */
01738     else
01739     {
01740       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_LOCK_UNLOCK_ERROR;
01741     }
01742   }
01743   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01744   return Status;
01745 }
01746 
01747 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25>>> */
01748 /*
01749  * This function switches the bus width to 4-bit if is supported.
01750  */
01751 status_t SDMMC004_lSwitchBusWidth(void)
01752 {
01753   uint32_t Argument = 0;
01754   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01755   uint32_t CardStatus = 0;
01756   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01757   do
01758   {
01759     /* Switch to transfer state i.e. CMD7 */
01760     Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01761     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_1>>> */
01762     if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01763     {
01764       break;
01765     }
01766     /* Disable Card Interrupt */
01767     CLR_BIT( SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_NORM, SDMMC_EN_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_INS_EN_Pos );
01768     /* MMC Card */
01769     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_2>>> */
01770 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01771     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01772     {
01773       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_MMC_COMMAND(6)),\
01774                                       MMC_4BUS_WIDTH_ARG,\
01775                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, &CardStatus);
01776       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_3>>> */
01777       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01778       {
01779         break;
01780       }
01781     }
01782     /* SD card */
01783     else
01784 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD*/
01785     {
01786       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_4>>> */
01787       /* Check the Data Transfer width supported in SCR Register */
01788       if( !(SDMMC004_CardInfo.Scr.SdBusWidth & SDMMC004_SCR_BUS_WIDTH4_BITMASK))
01789       {
01790         break;
01791       }
01792       /* Set the Argument.*/
01793       Argument |= SDMMC004_CardInfo.Rca << SDMMC004_ARG_RCA_BITPOS;
01794       /* Send Application Specific Command */
01795       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(55)), \
01796           Argument, \
01797           SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, \
01798           &CardStatus);
01799       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_5>>> */
01800       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01801       {
01802         break;
01803       }
01804       /* Send ACMD6 to switch the bus width. */
01805       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(58)), \
01806           SDMMC004_SD_4BUS_WIDTH_ARG, \
01807           SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1, \
01808           &CardStatus);
01809       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_25_6>>> */
01810       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01811       {
01812         break;
01813       }
01814     }
01815     /* Set Data Transfer Width  in Host Control Register. */
01816     SET_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_DATA_TX_WIDTH_Pos);
01817   } while(0);
01818   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01819   return Status;
01820 }
01821 
01822 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26>>> */
01823 /*
01824  * This function switches the card speed to high speed  if is supported.
01825  */
01826 status_t SDMMC004_lSwitchSpeed( void)
01827 {
01828 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01829   uint32_t CardStatus;
01830 #endif
01831   uint32_t SwitchStatus[16] = {0 };
01832   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01833   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01834   do
01835   {
01836 #if SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD
01837     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_1>>> */
01838     if ((SDMMC004_Handle.CardType & SDMMC004_MMC) != 0)
01839     {
01840       /* Switch to transfer state i.e. CMD7 */
01841       Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01842       if( Status != DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01843       {
01844         break;
01845       }
01846       Status = SDMMC004_lSendCommand(&(SDMMC004_MMC_COMMAND(6)),\
01847                                       MMC_HIGH_SPEED_ARG,\
01848                                       SDMMC004_RESPONSE_R1,&CardStatus);
01849       if (Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01850       {
01851         break;
01852       }
01853     }
01854     /* SD card */
01855     else
01856 #endif /* SDMMC_SUPPORT_MMC_CARD */
01857     {
01858       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_2>>> */
01859       /* Check CMD6 support in SCR register*/
01860       if ( SDMMC004_CardInfo.Scr.SdSpec == 0 )
01861       {
01862         break;
01863       }
01864       /* Switch to transfer state i.e. CMD7 */
01865       Status = SDMMC004_lSwitchToTransferState();
01866       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_3>>> */
01867       if( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS )
01868       {
01869         break;
01870       }
01871       /* Send the Switch function  command and read the transferred block of
01872        * data from the card */
01873       Status = SDMMC004_lSingleBlockTransfer( &(SDMMC004_SD_COMMAND(6)), \
01874                                               SDMMC004_SD_HIGH_SPEED_ARG,64, \
01875                                               (uint32_t*)SwitchStatus, \
01876                                                SDMMC004_READ_FROM_BUFF
01877                                              );
01878       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_4>>> */
01879       if ( Status != (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
01880       {
01881         break;
01882       }
01883       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_26_5>>> */
01884       if ( ((SwitchStatus[4] & SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC_GRP1_STATUS_BITMASK) >> \
01885           SDMMC004_SWITCH_FUNC_GRP1_STATUS_BITPOS) != 1UL )
01886       {
01887         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
01888         break;
01889       }
01890       /* Change Speed mode in the Host Controller */
01891       SET_BIT( SDMMC->HOST_CTRL,SDMMC_HOST_CTRL_HIGH_SPEED_EN_Pos );
01892     }
01893   } while(0);
01894   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01895   return Status;
01896 }
01897 
01898 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27>>> */
01899 /*
01900  * This function performs the recovery task if any error interrupt occurs.
01901  */
01902 status_t SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptRecovery
01903 (
01904   uint16_t InterruptStatus,
01905   uint8_t IssueAbort
01906 )
01907 {
01908   status_t Status =  (uint32_t)SDMMC004_NONRECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01909   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01910   do
01911   {
01912     /* Disable the Error Interrupt Signal  */
01913     SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR = 0;
01914     /* Check Error Interrupt Status bits D0-D3 for CMD line errors */
01915     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_1>>> */
01916     if ( ((InterruptStatus & SDMMC004_ERROR_CMD_STATUS_BITMASK) != 0 ) || \
01917         ( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_CMD_Msk ))
01918     {
01919       /* Set Software Reset for CMD Line  */
01920       Status = SDMMC004_lReset(SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_CMD_LINE_Msk);
01921     }
01922     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_2>>> */
01923     /* Check Error Interrupt Status bits D4-D6 for Data line errors */
01924     if ( ((InterruptStatus & SDMMC004_ERROR_DATA_STATUS_BITMASK) != 0 ) ||  \
01925         ( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_COMMAND_INHIBIT_DAT_Msk ))
01926     {
01927       /*  Set Software Reset for Data Line */
01928       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_3>>> */
01929       Status = SDMMC004_lReset( SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_DAT_LINE_Msk);
01930     }
01931     /*  Clear previous error status  */
01932     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR = SDMMC004_ALL_ERROR_STATUS_BITMASK ;
01933     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_4>>>  */
01934     if (IssueAbort == 1)
01935     {   
01936       /*  Issue Abort Command.  */
01937       /*  Set argument register */
01938       SDMMC->ARGUMENT1 = SDMMC004_ARGUMENT0;
01939       /*  Set command register */
01940       SDMMC->COMMAND = (uint16_t)(*(uint16_t*)&(SDMMC004_COMMON_COMMAND(12)));  
01941       /* Take the semaphores  */
01942       SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex = osSemaphoreWait(SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId,\
01943                                                 SDMMC004_DELAY_IN_COMMAND);
01944       /* <<< DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_5 >>> */
01945       if( SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreIndex < 0)
01946       {
01947         break;
01948       }  
01949       /* If error status bit is set in the Status register */
01950       /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_6>>> */
01951       if (SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR )
01952       {
01953         Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_NONRECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01954         SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR = SDMMC004_ALL_ERROR_STATUS_BITMASK ;
01955         SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC004_ALL_ERROR_STATUS_BITMASK ;
01956         /* Set Software Reset for CMD Line and Data Line  */
01957         SDMMC004_ReturnStatus = SDMMC004_lReset(SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_CMD_LINE_Msk | \
01958                                            SDMMC_SW_RESET_SW_RST_DAT_LINE_Msk );
01959         break;
01960       }
01961     }
01962     /* Check Data lines status in present status register  */
01963     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_27_7>>> */
01964     if (( (SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE  & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_DAT_3_0_PIN_LEVEL_Msk) >> \
01965         SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_DAT_3_0_PIN_LEVEL_Pos) == SDMMC004_ALL_DATA_LINES_HIGH)
01966     {
01967       Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_RECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01968     }
01969     else
01970     {
01971       Status =  (uint32_t)SDMMC004_NONRECOVERABLE_ERROR;
01972     }
01973   } while(0);
01974   /* Enable the Error Interrupt signal */
01975   SDMMC->EN_INT_SIGNAL_ERR |= SDMMC004_ERROR_INT_SIGNAL_ENABLE;
01976   /* Global Error Recovery Variable */
01977   SDMMC004_Handle.ErrorRecoveryStatus = (SDMMC004_ErrorCodesType)Status;
01978   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
01979   return Status;
01980 }
01981 
01982 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28>>> */
01983 /*
01984  * This function handles the Interrupt in Normal Interrupt Status Register.
01985  */
01986 status_t SDMMC004_lNormalInterruptHandler( uint16_t IntStatus)
01987 {
01988   status_t Status = (uint32_t)DAVEApp_SUCCESS;
01989   uint32_t Count;
01990   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
01991 #if SDMMC_CARD_DETECTION_SUPPORT
01992   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_1>>> */
01993   /* CARD REMOVAL INTERRUPT */
01994   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_REMOVAL_Msk) != 0)
01995   {
01996     /* Confirm that the Card Insertion bit is clear in Present State Status*/
01997     do
01998     {
01999     } while(( SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE &  SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_CARD_INSERTED_Msk)!= 0);
02000     /* Clear the Interrupt Status bit */
02001     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_REMOVAL_Msk;
02002  
02003     /* Call back to upper layer function for card removal interrupt*/
02004     if (SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr != NULL)
02005     {
02006       SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr(SDMMC004_CARD_REMOVAL); 
02007     }
02008     else
02009     {
02010       Status = SDMMC004_NULL_POINTER;
02011       ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status,0,0);
02012     }
02013 
02014   }
02015   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_2>>> */
02016   /* CARD INSERTION INTERRUPT */
02017   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_INS_Msk) != 0)
02018   {
02019     /* Confirm that the Card Insertion bit is set in Present State Status*/
02020     do
02021     {
02022     } while((SDMMC->PRESENT_STATE & SDMMC_PRESENT_STATE_CARD_INSERTED_Msk) == 0);
02023     /* Clear the Interrupt Status */
02024     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CARD_INS_Msk;
02025 
02026     /* Call back to upper layer function for card insertion interrupt*/
02027     if (SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr != NULL)
02028     {
02029       SDMMC004_Handle.CallBackPtr(SDMMC004_CARD_INSERTION); 
02030     }
02031     else
02032     {
02033       Status = SDMMC004_NULL_POINTER;
02034       ERROR(GID_SDMMC00x, Status,0,0);
02035     }
02036   }
02037 #endif
02038   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_3>>> */
02039   /* BUFFER READ READY INTERRUPT */
02040   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_Msk) != 0)
02041   {
02042     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02043     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_READ_READY_Msk;
02044     /* Update the Global Variable */
02045     SDMMC004_Handle.BufferReadyInterruptStatus = SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY;
02046     /* Check the global variable for any error in the block transfer */
02047     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_4>>> */
02048     if ( SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError == SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY)
02049     {
02050       for (Count=0; Count<SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes; Count++)
02051       {
02052         *SDMMC004_BufferPtr  = SDMMC->DATA_BUFFER;
02053         SDMMC004_BufferPtr++;
02054       }
02055       SDMMC004_BlockCount--;
02056     }
02057     /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_5>>> */
02058     /* Check Block Count */
02059     if (SDMMC004_BlockCount == 0)
02060     {
02061       /* Release the Semaphore */
02062       Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_DataSemaphoreId);
02063     }
02064   }
02065 
02066   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_5>>> */
02067   /* BUFFER WRITE READY INTERRUPT */
02068   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_Msk) != 0)
02069   {
02070 
02071     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02072     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_BUFF_WRITE_READY_Msk;
02073     /* Update the Global Variable */
02074     SDMMC004_Handle.BufferReadyInterruptStatus  = SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY;
02075     /* Check the global variable for any error in the block transfer */
02076     if ( SDMMC004_Handle.DataInterruptError == SDMMC004_BUFFER_READY)
02077     {
02078       for (Count=0; Count<SDMMC004_TransferQuadBytes; Count++)
02079       {
02080         SDMMC->DATA_BUFFER = *SDMMC004_BufferPtr;
02081         SDMMC004_BufferPtr++;
02082       }
02083       SDMMC004_BlockCount--;
02084     }
02085     if (SDMMC004_BlockCount == 0)
02086     {
02087       /* Release the Semaphore */
02088       Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_DataSemaphoreId);
02089     }
02090   }
02091   
02092   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_6>>> */
02093   /* TRANSFER COMPLETE INTERRUPT */
02094   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_Msk ) != 0)
02095   {
02096     /* Update the Global Variable */
02097     SDMMC004_Handle.TransferInterruptError = SDMMC004_TRANSFER_COMPLETE;
02098     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02099     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_TX_COMPLETE_Msk;
02100     /* Change the data line Status  to be free */
02101     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_DATA_ACTIVE;
02102     /* Release the Semaphore */
02103     Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_TransferSemaphoreId);
02104   }
02105   
02106   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_28_7>>> */
02107   /* COMMAND COMPLETE INTERRUPT */
02108   if ((IntStatus &  SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_Msk) != 0)
02109   {
02110     /* Update the Global Variable */
02111     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_COMMAND_COMPLETE;
02112     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02113     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_NORM = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_NORM_CMD_COMPLETE_Msk;
02114     /* Change the Command Line Status to free */
02115     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
02116     /* Release the Semaphore */
02117     Status =osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId);
02118   }
02119   FUNCTION_EXIT(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_EXIT);
02120   return (uint32_t)Status;
02121 }
02122 
02123 /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_29>>> */
02124 /*
02125  * This function handles the Interrupt in Error Interrupt Status Register.
02126  */
02127 
02128 status_t SDMMC004_lErrorInterruptHandler(uint16_t IntStatus)
02129 {
02130   status_t Status = (uint32_t)SDMMC004_ERROR;
02131 
02132   FUNCTION_ENTRY(GID_SDMMC00x, (uint32_t)SDMMC004_FUNCTION_ENTRY);
02133   SDMMC004_ISRContext.InterruptStatusShadow = IntStatus;
02134   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_29_1>>> */
02135   /* COMMAND TIMEOUT ERROR INTERRUPT */
02136   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_ERR_CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR_Msk)!= 0)
02137   {
02138     /* Update the Global Variable */
02139     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_COMMAND_TIMEOUT_ERROR;
02140     /* Change the Command Line Status to free */
02141     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
02142 #if SDMMC_UVP_TEST
02143     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_CommandErrorInterrupt == TRUE)
02144     {
02145       /* Forcefully disable the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
02146       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0000 ;
02147     }
02148     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Cmd55Error == TRUE)
02149     {
02150       /* Forcefully disable the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
02151       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0000 ;
02152     }
02153     if (Test_TriggerInterrupt.Trigger_Command42Error == TRUE)
02154     {
02155       /* Forcefully disable the Command Timeout Error Interrupt */
02156       SDMMC->FORCE_EVENT_ERR_STATUS = 0x0000 ;
02157     }
02158 #endif  /*SDMMC_UVP_TEST*/
02159     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02160     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR =  SDMMC_INT_STATUS_ERR_CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR_Msk;
02161     /* Release the Semaphore */
02162     Status =osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId);
02163   }
02164   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_29_2>>> */
02165   /* COMMAND CRC ERROR INTERRUPT */
02166   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_ERR_CMD_CRC_ERR_Msk ) != 0)
02167   {
02168     /* Update the Global Variable */
02169     SDMMC004_Handle.CommandInterruptError = SDMMC004_COMMAND_CRC_ERROR;
02170     /* Change the Command Line Status to free */
02171     SDMMC004_Handle.State &= ~SDMMC004_STATE_CMD_ACTIVE;
02172     /* Clear the Interrupt Status Bit */
02173     SDMMC->INT_STATUS_ERR = SDMMC_INT_STATUS_ERR_CMD_CRC_ERR_Msk;
02174     /* Release the Semaphore */
02175     Status = osSemaphoreRelease (SDMMC004_CmdSemaphoreId);
02176   }
02177   /* <<<DD_SDMMC_nonAPI_29_3>>> */
02178   /* COMMAND END BIT ERROR INTERRUPT */
02179   if ((IntStatus & SDMMC_INT_STATUS_ERR_CMD_END_BIT_ERR_Msk ) != 0)
02180   {
